body.name: Youdesure 10 Tier Shoe Rack, Sturdy Shoe Shelf, Tall Shoe Rack Organizer for 20 Pairs, Space-Saving, Non-Woven Fabric Shoe Shelf for Entryway, Garage, Bedroom, Black
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 7 hrs 4 mins
features: Materials and Structure: This shoe organizer is made of rust-proof metal pipes, waterproof non-woven fabric layers, and plastic connectors, providing stable, reliable support for your shoes and long-lasting durability.

DIY Assembly: You can remove one shelf to accommodate high heels and tall boots. Alternatively, you can split it into two separate shoe racks to adapt to different home scenarios. The freestanding shoe rack is a great choice for households.

Easy Assembly: No tools required, simply manually assemble using the provided parts for quick and convenient setup. When installing the shoe rack, make sure all components are firmly pressed together without any gaps. Additionally, placing heavier items on the bottom will provide greater stability.
Maximize Space: Measuring 17.7”L x 11”W x 59.4”H, it's perfect for storing in your wardrobe, hallway entrance, dorm room, apartment, garage, and more. It won't take up too much space.

1-Year After-Sales Service: Youdesure always stand firmly behind our customers. If there are any lost or damaged parts or assembly issues, please contact us immediately, and we will promptly resolve them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great all-purpose, lightweight organizer! Not just for shoes.
reviews.reviewText: I’ve enclosed two photos.One is of the product “under construction,” so you can see what you’re getting yourself into. This thing comes with 126 separate pieces and if you’re somewhat visuospatially challenged like me, I’d set aside a good 90 minutes to get it fully assembled. (It’s really not complicated and you don’t even need any tools, but you do need to make sure that all the plastic connectors are facing the right way and that all the metal rods are securely inserted.)The other photo is of the fully assembled rack— as you can see, I’m using it for organizing my clean laundry. For scale, I’m 5’5” and the rack is taller than me by 2-3 inches. It’s so tall that if you wanted to, you could break this apart into two 5-tier racks (or any other configuration).The “shelves” are not made of metal or plastic. They are instead made out of a tightly woven synthetic fabric with a papery feel. (If you lived through the ‘80s and remember the “paper jacket” trend, that’s what this reminds me of. Those jackets were stronger than they looked!)In other words, these are not hard, solid shelves. They are flexible and thin, but still easily able to support several pairs of shoes, stuffed toys, or piles of clothing. However I would not recommend storing books or heavy equipment on them.Overall, for $36 I am happy with this purchase and I love how lightweight the rack is! You can very easily carry it from one room to another, which is a nice bonus.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Definitely a good buy!
reviews.reviewText: Luckily I didn't listen to the bad reviews. A few mentioned it was flimsy or came apart. I can tell you this is 100% avoidable with proper assembly. Key tool: rubber mallet!! Make sure to use the mallet to push all pp connectors fully into all metal rods. Very, very sturdy. I installed it in my garage so my kids can leave their shoes before entering the house from school and sports. My husband and son both wear size 11 and you can fit 4 pairs of mens shoes in one tier. My only hesitation was I wasn't sold on fabric tiers but it's actually a light weight yet strong shelving option. Only time will tell how it holds up. Another bad review mentioned it was missing a pp connector and they returned it. When I first assembled all the pp connectors (before stacking them up) I thought the same thing but I did the math wrong and they were actually spares! So don't jump to conclusions until you have it all together. I included a photo of the spares. I also anchored it to the wall to avoid any accidental fall if the kids are rough playing in the garage since it is lightweight so it definitely adds to the sturdiness. I'm a busy 5ft mom and it took me about 25min, so anyone can do it! Not difficult, just tedious. Hope this helps!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good but untable
reviews.reviewText: This item is easy to assemble and has enough space for many pairs of shoes, You can even fit more than 50 pair. I assembled it easily in less than 45 minutes. But unfortunately it's not strong and unstable. I foresee it breaking down in less than one or two years depending on usage. Not good for a household with small restless children because it can easy fall off when pushed. Overall it's manageable and cheap stuff.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love this shoe rack. I was actually surprised at how sturdy it is with how tall it gets. I put this in my coat closet and it saved so much space!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Take your time and do it right.
reviews.reviewText: When I opened up this box I told my wife that it was a thousand piece Erector Set puzzle. And if you can put yourself into the kiddie mentality and approach it that way it is easy to put together.I read a lot of reviews about how flimsy it was and how it would fall apart. Well people...HAVENT ANY OF YOU EVER HEARED ABOUT J.B. WELD CLEAR EPOXY?Here is how I put it together. Feed the: "A" rods through the shelves. Then epoxy the plastic corners onto the ends of the "B" rods. Make sure to keep the 'hole" side facing in the same direction. Put a small amount of glue onto the ends of the rods and not into the plastic parts. A little bit goes al long way. To make sure that they all are straight and square, place the rods onto a flat tabletop and move the ends around until the rod no loner rocks on the flat surface at either end and it will be straight and square. Let the glue dry for about 3 hours before proceeding to the next part.Next glue Glue the "B" rods to the A rods. To make sure that is flat and square, put the shelf onto the tabletop and work with it until all four feet sit onto the tabletop without rocking. Wait for glue to dry. Next glue the "c rod onto the upper "holes" of each shelf. DO NOT GLUES THE SHELVES TOGETHER AT THIS TIME. Let the glue dry. And then finally glue the shelves together. Remember the top shelf does not have any "C" rods in it. But the most important part of it all is to make sure that when you glue the ends on the "B" rods that all of the "Holes" face up in the same direction at each end of the rod.Yeah, it took longer to put together this way but I now have a set of really solid shelves that will not fall apart.PS.Make sure you push the rod all the way into the plastic corner, otherwise it wont turn out square.J.B. WELD:https://www.amazon.com/J-B-Weld-50112-Clear-0-85/dp/B009EU5ZM0/ref=sr_1_6?dchild=1&keywords=J.B.+Weld+clear+epoxy&qid=1622449695&sr=8-6

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I chose this shoe rack for its slim depth and its height. Vertical storage to save floor space in the walk-thru closet. I didn't realize the shelf material was fabric, but that's just fine. It goes on taught, no sagging / so far. Assembly was obvious from a once-over the illustrations. It's taller than I needed so I just left off 1 layer: it doesn't make any difference in it holding together. Keeping the parts in case of more shoes. It's light weight but that's just fine if you're not bumping into it. As long as the pieces & layers are squared off as you go, it stands just fine. The shelf height is fairly small so booties did not always fit standing up - ok, I just put them on their sides. Enough room that a couple pairs fit still in their boxes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Light weight rods
reviews.reviewText: Not as sturdy because it is 5ft tall and the rods are too light is weight. Few rods were already bent a little. It definitely has the capacity to hold at least 40 pairs of shoes. Just lacks sturdiness.
The fabric is like paper so thin, and pipes are very light douty. Doesn't last long.
